China bid to 'cheat' its way to chip prominence failing -Taiwan's US envoyChina has sought to "cheat" and "steal" its way to matching Taiwan in chip technology, but has yet to succeed despite investing huge sums, Taiwan's de facto ambassador to Washington said on Wednesday, while holding out the prospect of more Taiwanese semiconductor investment in the U.S. Wed, 07 Feb 2024 23:05:02 GMT XO5OMXJ2UBO3PE2VJR6GRMALJ4 https://www.reuters.com/world/china-bid-cheat-its-way-chip-prominence-failing-taiwans-us-envoy-2024-02-07/Michael Martina, David Brunnstrom世界
Chinese firm behind ‘news’ websites pushes pro-Beijing content globally, researchers findMore than 100 websites disguised as local news outlets in Europe, Asia and Latin America are pushing pro-China content in a widespread influence campaign linked to a Beijing public relations firm, digital watchdog Citizen Lab has found. Wed, 07 Feb 2024 22:24:23 GMT 7PWM7VI6IVIO7NC7ZIADYZWXIY https://www.reuters.com/world/chinese-firm-behind-news-websites-pushes-pro-beijing-content-globally-2024-02-07/Zeba Siddiqui世界

As China battles to shore up battered markets, investors hold out for moreChina's ousting of its securities watchdog head on Wednesday drew a muted cheer from markets, with investors holding out for bigger measures that would tackle the root of the malaise gripping the world's second-largest economy. Wed, 07 Feb 2024 17:46:59 GMT QPPJTHMULRMAPD7QUCRPOCH22Y https://www.reuters.com/markets/asia/china-battles-shore-up-battered-markets-investors-hold-out-more-2024-02-07/Reuters市场亚洲市场
Chinese hacking campaign aimed at critical infrastructure goes back five years, US saysAn advanced group of Chinese hackers taking aim at U.S. critical infrastructure have been active for as long as half a decade, American and allied intelligence agencies said in a joint statement on Wednesday. Wed, 07 Feb 2024 16:45:40 GMT 7N23JAKQPJLZVKVEIWGXEPVKYI https://www.reuters.com/world/chinese-hacking-campaign-aimed-ritic-infrastruct-goes-back- Five-years-us-2024-02-07/Raphael Satter世界
'Long and tedious journey': companies sour on China outlookSome of the world's top food, drinks and tech companies have struck a sour tone about Chinese demand, deepening investor worries about damage to firms exposed to the country and Beijing's ability to revive the world's second-biggest economy. Wed, 07 Feb 2024 16:39:32 GMT 23EYJWYE6NJNJA5QITNW4IRBXE https://www.reuters.com/world/china/long-tedious-journey-companies-sour-china-outlook-2024-02-07/Helen Reid, Emma Rumney, Ananya Mariam Rajesh世界中国
